721354f.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 49th Street (East)
721354f.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, between 49th and 50th Streets, the rear of 438, 440, 442 amd 444 Madison Avenue, buildings
demolished in 1930.
Wurts Brothers  May 6, 1915

713381f-a.title: Manhattan: 49th Street - Madison Avenue
713381f-a.text:
49th Street,Gsouth side, west from Madison Avenue.
April 4, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, as seen across clearance at the N.W. corner of Madison Ave.
September 28, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

721352f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 49th Street (East)
721352f-a.text:
Madison Avenue at N.E. corner of 49th Street, showing Hotel New Weston, with Columbia College tablet on wall. On N.W. corner is lot shown vacant in preparation for erection of 444 Madison Avenue building
in the following year.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

721358f-b.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 49th Street
721358f-b.text:
Madison Avenue, east side of block between 449th and 50th Streets. Excavation in foreground is site of 444 Madison Avenue building,
1931.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  ir.ea th GS9
(2)
Madison Avenue, east side, between 49th and 50th Streets, seen across excavation where 444 now stands. Includes Rotel New Weston, old building on right (49th Street) and new building
(50th Street) on left, just completed.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  VVeog ii 4Ao

721360f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 49th Street
721360f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, south from 50th Street, showing block of smsll buildings on west side, 50th to 49th Streets which were demolished the following year, and the old building on S. 2. corner of 50th Street, which wes demolished late in 1929 to mske room for the
new building of Hotel New Weston.
July 1929.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
(2)
yedison Avenue, west side, looking south from 50th Street. Plock of low houses in foreground, tetween 50th and 49th Street, was
demolished in 1930.
Conspicuous in background is the Lincoln fuilding.
Just visible in the extreme background is the top of the Metropolitan
Life Building tower.
March 4, 1930.
P.L. Sperr,Photorrapher.

new building of Hotel New Weston.

(2)
yedison Avenue, west side, looking south from 50th Street. Plock of low houses in foreground, tetween 50th and 49th Street, was

713382f-a.title: Manhattan: 49th Street - Madison Avenue
713382f-a.text:
49th Street, north side, west from Madison Avenue.
April 4, 1932..
P. L. Sperr.

731210f-b.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Firemen.
731210f-b.text:
(11
The New York City Fire Department "Holy Name Society'I marching west almng 49th Street, at Madison Ave., enroute to St. Patrick's
Cathedral for a Sunday High Mass.
About 19357
(2)
The same scene, from a slightly different angle; looking east along
49th Street, from Madison Ave.
About 19357
(3)
The same scene, looking west along 49th Street, from Madison Ave.
The cortege is seen turning north at Fifth Ave.
About 1935t

713380f-a.title: Manhattan: 49th Street (East) - Madison Avenue
713380f-a.text:
41-45 East 49th Street, north side, between Madison and Park Avenues.
About 1911.

721349f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 49th Street (East)
721349f-a.text:
Madison Ave., south from, and including East 49th Street. The 5-story corner house, on the left, is No. 34 East 49th Street.
March 12, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
